databricks:position-deletes:v2.notes: Supported via Delta Lake UniForm Iceberg compatibility layer

databricks:position-deletes:v3.notes: Supported with Iceberg V3 managed tables

databricks:equality-deletes:v2.notes: Supported via Delta Lake UniForm Iceberg compatibility layer

databricks:equality-deletes:v3.notes: Supported with Iceberg V3 managed tables

databricks:merge-on-read:v2.notes: Databricks uses deletion vectors which function similarly to merge-on-read

databricks:merge-on-read:v3.notes: Supported with Iceberg V3 deletion vectors

databricks:column-default-values:v2.notes: Column default values are a V3 feature

databricks:column-default-values:v3.notes: Supported with Iceberg V3 on Databricks

databricks:nanosecond-timestamps:v2.notes: Nanosecond timestamps are a V3 feature

databricks:nanosecond-timestamps:v3.notes: Supported with Iceberg V3 on Databricks

databricks:multi-arg-transforms:v2.notes: Multi-argument transforms are a V3 feature

databricks:multi-arg-transforms:v3.notes: Supported with Iceberg V3 on Databricks

databricks:time-travel:v2.notes: Time travel supported via Delta Lake and Iceberg interop

databricks:table-maintenance:v2.notes: Predictive optimization provides automatic compaction, vacuum, and optimization

databricks:table-maintenance:v3.notes: Predictive optimization provides automatic compaction, vacuum, and optimization

databricks:branching-tagging:v2.notes: Databricks supports shallow clones for isolation but not native Iceberg branching and tagging API
caveats: Uses Delta Lake shallow clones rather than native Iceberg branches/tags

databricks:branching-tagging:v3.notes: Databricks supports shallow clones for isolation but not native Iceberg branching and tagging API
caveats: Uses Delta Lake shallow clones rather than native Iceberg branches/tags

databricks:read-support:v2.notes: Full read support for Iceberg tables via UniForm and foreign tables

databricks:read-support:v3.notes: Full read support for Iceberg V3 tables

databricks:write-insert:v2.notes: INSERT INTO supported for Iceberg managed tables

databricks:write-insert:v3.notes: INSERT INTO supported for Iceberg V3 managed tables

databricks:write-merge-update-delete:v2.notes: MERGE, UPDATE, DELETE supported for Iceberg managed tables

databricks:write-merge-update-delete:v3.notes: MERGE, UPDATE, DELETE supported for Iceberg V3 managed tables

databricks:catalog-integration:v2.notes: Unity Catalog provides native Iceberg REST Catalog API support

databricks:catalog-integration:v3.notes: Unity Catalog provides native Iceberg REST Catalog API support

databricks:hive-metastore:v2.notes: Can read from external Hive Metastore via Lakehouse Federation

databricks:hive-metastore:v3.notes: Can read from external Hive Metastore via Lakehouse Federation

databricks:aws-glue-catalog:v2.notes: Can read from AWS Glue Catalog via Lakehouse Federation

databricks:aws-glue-catalog:v3.notes: Can read from AWS Glue Catalog via Lakehouse Federation

databricks:rest-catalog:v2.notes: Unity Catalog implements the Iceberg REST Catalog API

databricks:rest-catalog:v3.notes: Unity Catalog implements the Iceberg REST Catalog API

databricks:nessie:v2.notes: Databricks does not natively support Nessie catalog

databricks:nessie:v3.notes: Databricks does not natively support Nessie catalog

databricks:polaris:v2.notes: Can connect to Polaris via REST Catalog API

databricks:polaris:v3.notes: Can connect to Polaris via REST Catalog API

databricks:unity-catalog:v2.notes: Native Unity Catalog with Iceberg REST Catalog API support

databricks:unity-catalog:v3.notes: Native Unity Catalog with Iceberg REST Catalog API support for V3

databricks:hadoop-catalog:v2.notes: Databricks does not support Hadoop catalog for Iceberg

databricks:hadoop-catalog:v3.notes: Databricks does not support Hadoop catalog for Iceberg

databricks:jdbc-catalog:v2.notes: Databricks does not support JDBC catalog for Iceberg

databricks:jdbc-catalog:v3.notes: Databricks does not support JDBC catalog for Iceberg
